decent.translation[0].definitions[0].def: of a good enough standard or quality
decent.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Don’t you have a decent jacket?
a house with a decent-sized yard
Their in-flight magazine is halfway decent (=quite good).
decent.translation[0].definitions[1].def: following moral standards that are acceptable to society
decent.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
The chairman did the decent thing (=did what people thought he ought to) and resigned.
The majority of residents here are decent citizens.
decent.translation[0].definitions[2].def: treating people in a fair and kind way
decent.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I decided her father was a decent guy after all.
It was decent of you to show up today.
decent.translation[0].definitions[3].def: wearing enough clothes so that you do not show too much of your body – used humorously
decent.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Are you decent? Can I come in?
